Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: GKN Aerospace North America, Inc. agreed to pay a $22,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it shipped a dumpster filled with trichloroethylene-contaminated waste to a landfill that was not licensed for hazardous waste.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20060210061131/http://www.ag.state.il.us/pressroom/2005_07/20050708b.html

Description: GKN Sinter Metals, Keeney Rigging and Trucking, and Joseph Freedman Co. agreed to pay a total of $27,000 in civil penalties in settlement of allegations they improperly removed and disposed of asbestos-containing ovens at GKN's smelting facility. The announcement did not indicate how much each would pay. Here we assume the amount was divided equally among them.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20100529211749/http://www.mass.gov/?pageID=cagopressrelease&L=1&L0=Home&sid=Cago&b=pressrelease&f=2010_04_29_gkn_keeney_freedman&csid=Cago
https://www.faa.gov/news/press_releases/news_story.cfm?newsId=14036
https://www.faa.gov/about/office_org/headquarters_offices/agc/practice_areas/enforcement/reports/

Description: Hoeganaes Corporation agreed to pay $1.45 million to settle a class action alleging that iron emissions from its powdered metals plant in New Jersey damaged boats in nearby marinas.
Private Litigation Case Title: Glen Staub and Marilyn Staub v. Hoeganaes Corporation
Info Source: 2006 Mealey's Jury Verdicts & Settlements 518
https://www.faa.gov/about/office_org/headquarters_offices/agc/practice_areas/enforcement/reports/
